subject: Re: [junit] JUnit testing of servlet and HTTP servlet requests
msgSnippet: ... Tomcat has an equivalent, serlet-api.jar I haven t done serious J2EE work in about long, either, and I d like to keep it that way. The whole J2EE space is
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> I would just add j2ee.jar and be done with it. At least that's what
> JBoss provides me. I confess I don't remember the details anymore, since
> I haven't done serious J2EE work in at least three years.

Tomcat has an equivalent, serlet-api.jar

I haven't done serious J2EE work in about long, either, and I'd like to
keep it that way. The whole J2EE space is too fat, baroque, and complex
for my tastes. YMMV.

Servlets with Tomcat or Resin is much lighter and easier to understand.


--
Pat Farrell pfarrell@...
www.bioinformatx.com
